figure_1.title: Figure 1.
figure_1.caption: Flow diagram of the subjects' recruitment in this study. All the subjects were divided into the atropine use group and the control group who had never used atropine (n = 106 : 103).

claims.sentence: Participants were divided into two groups: 106 in the atropine group and 103 in the nonatropine group (Figure 1).
Figure 2 shows the relative peripheral refractions (RPR) of emmetropes in the atropine and the nonatropine group.
In Figure 2, the relative peripheral refractions of spherical equivalent (M) in the atropine group showed more myopia in the nasal field or temporal field.
M = spherical equivalent, J180 = J180 astigmatism; J45 = J45 astigmatism.Figure 2.

For astigmatism J45, the atropine group showed more relative peripheral myopia at 10° of the temporal and at 10°, 20°, and 30° of the nasal field compared to the nonatropine group, but there were no statistically significant differences (see Figure 3).

For J45, the atropine group showed more relative peripheral myopia at 20° and 30° of the temporal field and 30° of the nasal field compared to the nonatropine group; a significant difference was observed at 30° of the temporal field (t = 2.84, df = 36, P=0.01) (see Figure 4).
Participants were divided into two groups: 106 in the atropine group and 103 in the nonatropine group (Figure 1).
